name: GetNewsletterVariantClickMetrics
description:
Get link click metrics for a newsletter variant.

Retrieve metrics related to link clicks for an individual newsletter variant, such as language variations or A/B test messages. By default, the data covers up to 45 days. Specify the period and steps to customize the data range.

parameters.name: newsletter_identifier
parameters.description: The unique integer identifier of a specific newsletter to retrieve click metrics.

parameters.name: message_content_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of a specific message within a newsletter, useful for A/B tests or multilingual newsletters. Retrieve from newsletter details.

value_schema.description: The identifier of a message in a newsletter. If your newsletter is an A/B test or has multiple languages, you may have multiple `content_id` values for your newsletter. You can [get a newsletter](#operation/getNewsletters) to find your newsletter's content IDs.

parameters.name: time_unit_for_report
parameters.description: The unit of time for generating the report. Options are: hours, days, weeks, months.

value_schema.description: The unit of time for your report.

parameters.name: number_of_periods
parameters.description: Specify the number of time periods to retrieve data for. Defaults to the maximum if not specified, or 12 for months. Maximum limits: 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, or 121 months.

value_schema.description: The number of periods you want to return. Defaults to the maximum available, or `12` if the period is in `months`. Maximums are 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, or 121 months. Days start at 00:00 EST. Weeks start at 00:00 EST on Sunday. Months start at 00:00 EST on the 1st of the month.

parameters.name: item_type_for_metrics
parameters.description: The type of item to return metrics for. Options are: email, webhook, twilio, slack, push, in_app. When left empty, metrics for all types are included.

value_schema.description: The type of item you want to return metrics for. When empty, the response contains metrics for all possible types.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Customer.io App API

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: The unit of time for your report.

value_schema.description: The unit of time for your report.

parameters.name: steps
parameters.description: The number of periods you want to return. Defaults to the maximum available, or `12` if the period is in `months`. Maximums are 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, or 121 months. Days start at 00:00 EST. Weeks start at 00:00 EST on Sunday. Months start at 00:00 EST on the 1st of the month.

value_schema.description: The number of periods you want to return. Defaults to the maximum available, or `12` if the period is in `months`. Maximums are 24 hours, 45 days, 12 weeks, or 121 months. Days start at 00:00 EST. Weeks start at 00:00 EST on Sunday. Months start at 00:00 EST on the 1st of the month.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of item you want to return metrics for. When empty, the response contains metrics for all possible types.

value_schema.description: The type of item you want to return metrics for. When empty, the response contains metrics for all possible types.

parameters.name: content_id
parameters.description: The identifier of a message in a newsletter. If your newsletter is an A/B test or has multiple languages, you may have multiple `content_id` values for your newsletter. You can [get a newsletter](#operation/getNewsletters) to find your newsletter's content IDs.

value_schema.description: The identifier of a message in a newsletter. If your newsletter is an A/B test or has multiple languages, you may have multiple `content_id` values for your newsletter. You can [get a newsletter](#operation/getNewsletters) to find your newsletter's content IDs.
